subtitle: hi this is sim and Jacobson and welcome
to meaningful Monday's where we answer
your personal questions the question
this week is about relationships I'm
generally a friendly and warm person I
believe people perceive me as socially
normal I've had close friendships before
and still maintain a couple but over the
years I found it more and more difficult
to open up and share closeness with
friends and family and when presented
with the opportunity to make new friends
I tend to keep a safe distance
accumulating mere acquaintances the
thought of calling up a neighbor and
asking her to go out for coffee is
totally nerve-wracking for me I think
she probably has other friends she would
rather spend time with and we might run
out of things to talk about how can I
begin to change a fundamental principle
in life that can really change our
attitudes to everything our
relationships our friendships are
acquaintances even casual encounters is
to understand that we're all in a
symbiotic unified harmonious world we're
essentially like organs in one large
organism and that's why there's a
give-and-take we need each other and we
each complement each other hillel the
great sage said if I'm not for myself
who will be for me but then he added if
I'm only for myself what am I which
teaches us that we both have what to
give and what to take and when you
contemplate on that you look for friends
that really can complement you and that
you need them and they need you instead
of it being this type of insecure
attitude will they want to hang out with
you will they not want to hang out with
you so when you ask a question about
friendships and the difficulty in
maintaining them there are two aspects
to it it could be one's own fears and
not allowing themselves to really
recognize their own inner sole their own
inner strengths and at the same time
also not recognize that other people
have strengths and beautiful at
components that can help you or there
may be other factors that may be
underlie this question and that is as
one matures one becomes more isolated
more wary
more sensitive and more careful but
imagine that what parts of a body or
parts of nature would cease to want to
interact with everyone else it would
destroy the universe there's a certain
breathing a certain exhaling and
inhaling a cross-pollination that's
necessary in all components of life and
especially in our friendships one way
practically to be able to change your
attitude about the fearfulness or the
voiding interacting because you're
afraid that your friends may not
appreciate you or they may have other
friends is to look inside yourself and
say you have something to contribute
something your friends can use as well
and they have something to contribute to
you this isn't just a personal matter
this is a matter that is necessary and
perhaps in the fulfillment of our entire
purpose in this world you look at
yourself in that type positive light and
you find that beauty and others that's a
very good reason to get out of your
house and go for a coffee and meet with
someone whether it's a casual walk or
something more intense and create that
relationship that allows us all to
breathe in a healthier way this has been
meaningful Monday's if you'd like to
submit your own personal question please
click on the link below everyone have a
very meaningful
